page.title: 01BANKS AND CROSSENS
page.content: BANKS AND CROSSENS ARE ADJOINING VILLAGES IN THE NORTH MEOLS AREA.NEW HOUSING ESTATES HAVE BEEN BUILT IN THE LAST 15 YEARS BRINGING AN INCREASE IN THE LOCAL POPULATION. SHOPS AND SERVICES ARE GOOD. THERE ARE 3 SCHOOLS,3 CHURCHES,A POST OFFICE, POLICE STATION,2 SEWAGE WORKS,HEALTH CENTRE AND A HOSPITAL. THE AREA IS BOUNDED BY MARSHLAND SOME OFWHICH IS ENCLOSED AND CULTIVATED. THE BUS SERVICE PROVIDES ROUTES TO THE NEARBY LARGE TOWNS OF PRESTON,SOUTHPORT, CHORLEY,ORMSKIRK AND LIVERPOOL. LOCAL NEWSPAPERS ARE THE SOUTHPORT VISITER AND ORMSKIRK ADVERTISER. THERE IS SOME LOCAL EMPLOYMENT, SUCH AS MARKET GARDENING AND ARABLE FARMING AND WORK IN LOCAL SHOPS AND SERVICES.MANY PEOPLE TRAVEL TO WORK IN NEARBY TOWNS.
